column4: Okay, I went to dual boot windows and ubuntu, I have ubuntu installed, but the windows install disc can't figure out my drive type, so it can't partition part off.  How do I go about doing that manually as a NTFS drive so I can install windows on it?
if you just installed ubuntu you might consider starting over and install windows first then ubuntu.. it will go much smoother. Windows likes to be first on a dual boot system.
if you're not going to be playing games on the windows side, consider installing windows in a Virtual Machine like Virtual Box. It will then run "inside" of Ubuntu

scunizi, I've had ubuntu installed for a good 3 months, starting over is not an option. I do not want to lose my data, any other way? I mean, I know I can run Virtual Box or VMWare, but I would prefer a dual boot
scunizi, I do plan to be playing games~

sure.. use gparted to make space ... unpartitioned space for windows.. it will discover it.. after install you'll have to fix grub because you won't be able to boot into ubuntu.. windows overwrites the MBR
Okay, using gparted to make space wont be hard. What do you mean I'll have to fix grub?
since windows will overwrite the Master Boot Record the grub menu won't show up to boot into ubutnu. You'll have to use the Live CD to fix grub and rewrite the MBR.
!grub | Spherous
